original: Carlander, Pehr Olof, major, Göteborg, f. 8/8/78 i Gbg av prakt, läk., med. lic. Olof Immanuel C. o. Maria SopMe Lovisa Carlsson. G. 06 m. frih :an Hedda Barnekow. Barn: Folke f. 09, Nils 10, Sophie-Louise 13, Magnus 15, Märtha 18, Elisabeth 24. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 97, off:ex. 99, GCI 04-06. Res. t. Ryssl. 02-03 o. 13-14. Und:löjtn. v. Älvsb. reg. 99, löjtn. 04, kapt. 13, major i armén 28. Vik. gymn:lär. v. norra real i Sthlm 06, v. Borås h. a. 1. 11-12. Befälh. f. Gbgs stads landst:omr. nr 28 a 29-42, mil. led. av Gbgs friv. motorbåtsflott. 31-35. RSO, CFB GM, Gbgs ’land&t :förb. GM, FinrSftjk.
translated: Carlander, Pehr Olof, Major, Gothenburg (Göteborg). Born August 8, 1878 in Gothenburg to Practical (Praktisk) Doctor (Läkare) with Medical Licentiate (Medicinsk Licentiat) Olof Immanuel C. and Maria Sofia Lovisa Carlsson. He married Baroness (Friherrinna) Hedda Barnekow in 1906 and they had six children: Folke born in 1909, Nils in 1910, Sophie-Louise in 1913, Magnus in 1915, Märtha in 1918, and Elisabeth in 1924. He completed his high school education in Gothenburg in 1897 and achieved his officer's rank in 1899. From 1904 to 1906, he attended the Military Academy (GCI). He also served in Russia twice: in 1902-1903 and 1913-1914. He was a second lieutenant in the Älvsborg Regiment in 1899, promoted to lieutenant in 1904, captain in 1913, and major in 1928. He was a temporary gymnastics teacher at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1906, and at Borås Higher Industrial School (Högsta Allmänna Läroverket) from 1911 to 1912. He commanded Gothenburg City's (Stads) Rural District No. 28 and 29-42, and was a military leader of the Gothenburg Volunteer Motorboat Fleet (Frivilliga Motorbåtsflottan) from 1931 to 1935. He was awarded the Order of the Sword (RSO), the Merit Cross of the Swedish Order of Freemasons (CFB GM), and the Gothenburg Rural Association's (Landsting) Merit (GM), as well as the Finnish Order of the White Rose (FinrSftjk).
